SELECT x.ProcessId as 'Main Process ID',x.ProcessName as 'Process Name',x.ProcessDescription as 'Process Desc' , y.UserName as 'Created User', x.CreatedDate as 'Created Date' FROM PM_Processes x, PM_Users y WHERE x.Status=@Status AND x.CreatedBy = y.User_Id Order by [Created Date]
INSERT INTO PM_Processes(ProcessName,ProcessDescription,Status,CreatedBy,CreatedDate) OUTPUT Inserted.ProcessId VALUES(@ProcessName,@ProcessDescription,1,@CreatedBy,GETDATE())
UPDATE PM_SubProcesses SET Status=0 WHERE ProcessId in (@ProcessIdList)
UPDATE PM_Processes SET Status=0 WHERE ProcessId in (@ProcessIdList)
SELECT x.SubProcessId as 'Sub Process ID',x.SubProcessName as 'Sub Process Name', x.Description as 'Description', y.UserName as 'Created User', x.CreatedDate as 'Created Date' FROM PM_SubProcesses x, PM_Users y WHERE x.ProcessId=@ProcessId AND x.Status=1 AND x.CreatedBy = y.User_Id
UPDATE PM_SubProcesses SET Status=0 WHERE SubProcessId in (@SubProcessIdList)
INSERT INTO PM_SubProcesses(SubProcessName,ProcessId,Status,CreatedDate,CreatedBy,Description) OUTPUT Inserted.SubProcessId VALUES(@SubProcessName,@ProcessId,1,GETDATE(),@CreatedBy,@Description)
SELECT ProcessId,ProcessName FROM PM_Processes WHERE Status=@Status
SELECT COUNT(ProcessId) AS ProcessCount FROM PM_Processes WHERE Status=1 AND CreatedBy = @loggedUserId
LoadUserWiseProcessDetails
SELECT ProcessId,ProcessName,ProcessDescription,CreatedDate FROM PM_Processes WHERE Status=1 AND CreatedBy= @CreatedUser
update PM_Processes set ProcessDescription = @Description where ProcessId = @ProcessID
update PM_SubProcesses set Description = @Description where SubProcessId = @ProcessID
